dmca.title: Infringement of Boy Scouts of America's Trademark Rights on venturing.com
dmca.body:
Dear Matt Alberts,
 
Boy Scouts of America is the owner of the well-known trademark and trade name VENTURING.  As you are no doubt aware, VENTURING is the trademark used to identify activities and events related to the Boy Scouts of America.  
 
In connection to the Boy Scouts of America proprietary rights over its famous trademark we bring to your attention the following:
 
1) You have registered, without the Boy Scouts of America's permission or authorization, the domain name 'venturing.com'.  The Domain Name incorporates the famous VENTURING mark in its entirety, and, by its very composition, suggests the Boy Scouts of America's sponsorship or endorsement of your website and correspondingly, your activities. You should be aware that in 1916, the United States Congress recognized that the marks and names of the Boy Scouts of America program had to be protected and Congress passed a Special Act of Congress (36 USC
